projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

div.head:
Com' Concil' tent' in Camera Guihald' Civitat' London' Die Veneris Septimo die Junij Anno Dom' 1700 Anno
que Regni Regis Willielmi Tertij Angl' &c. Duodecimo. Coram Ricardo Levett Mil', Major' Civitat' praed', Johannne Moore Mil', Thoma Stamp Mil', Thoma Lane Mil', Johanne Houblon Mil', Edvardo Clark Mil', Humphrido Edwin Mil', ac eju≈ød Civitat' Aldermannis, Salathiel Lovel Mil', Servien' ad legem ac Recordat' dict' Civitat', Johanne Par≈øons Mil', Wil' Gore Mil', Jacobo Houblon Mil', & Thoma Rawlin≈øon Mil', ac eju≈ød' Civit. Aldermannis & Carolo Duncombe Mil', Aldro ac un' Vic' Dictae Civitat', nec non majori parte Communiar' in codem Communi Concil' tunc & ibidem a≈ø≈øemblat'.

div.p: IT is Ordered, That the Act of Common Council made in the Mayoralty of Sir Robert Ducy Knight and Baronet, relating to the Choice, Election and Confirmation of Sheriffs for this City and County of Middle≈øex: As al≈øo another Act in the time of the Mayoralty of Sir William A≈øhhur≈øt Knight, which Repeals Two Clau≈øes in Two Acts of Common Council made in the ≈øeveral Mayoralties of the ≈øaid Sir Robert Ducy, and Sir VVilliam Pritchard Knight, touching ≈øuch Choice, Election and Confirmation, be Printed together, and that each Deputy and Common Council-man of the ≈øeveral Wards of this City have one of the ≈øaid Books when Printed

div.head: Commune Concilium tent' in Camera Guihald' Civitat LONDON, vice≈øimo die Julii, Annoque Regni Dom no≈øtri CAROLI nunc Regis Angliae, &c. Septimo, Coram Roberto Ducy, Mil' & Baronet Majore Civitat' London, Thoma Middleton, Mil' & Aldermanno Civitat' London, Nicholao Rainton, Radalpho Freeman, Thoma Moul≈øton, Rowlando Haylin, Roberto Parkhur≈øt, Johan' Poole, Chr. Cletherow, Ricard Penn, Mauritio Abbot, Mil' & Alderman', Henrico Garway, Rowlando Backhou≈øe Aldermannis; Willielmo Action Mil', & Baronetto, ac Aldermanno, Humphrido Smith & Edmundo Wright, eju≈ødem Civitatis Aldermannis; Anthony Abdy & Roberto Cambel, eju≈ødem Civitat' Vicecom', ac major' parte Communiar' de Communi Concilio eju≈ødem Civitat' a≈ø≈øemblat', ubi tune & ibidem Enactitat' fuit, prout ≈øequitur.
div.p:
WHereas an Act of Council made the Fifth Day of May in the Thirty fourth Year of the Reign of our late Sovereign Lady Queen Elizabeth, of England, &c. in the time of the Mayoralty of Sir William Webb, Kt. decea≈øed; one Act was made and ordained, for, touching and concerning the Choice, Election and Confirmation of the Sheriffs of this City, and the County of Middle≈øex. And whereas al≈øo divers other Acts of Common Council have been made touching the ≈øame, Be it therefore Enacted by the Lord Mayor, Aldermen and Common Council of this City, That the ≈øaid Act made the ≈øaid Fifth Day of May in the Four and thirtieth Year afore≈øaid, and all other the ≈øaid Acts made touching or concerning the Choice, Election and Confirmation of the Sheriffs of this City and County of Middle≈øex, ≈øhall be void and of none effect,
for that the ≈øame Laws have not taken ≈øo good Effect as might be wi≈øhed, by rea≈øon that the Penalties and Forfeitures therein contained, have been over-mild, and thereby His Maje≈øties Service have been in Danger of Prejudice, and the good Citizens of this City, by rea≈øon of often Refu≈øal of the ≈øaid Office of Shrievalty have been much troubled and di≈øquieted; For better Reformation whereof, Be it now therefore Enacttd, Ordained and E≈øtabli≈øhed by the Lord Mayor, and Aldermen and Commons in this Common Council A≈ø≈øembled, and by the Authority of the ≈øame, That from henceforth for ever the Day as well for Confirmation and Allowance of ≈øuch Per≈øons as hereafter ≈øhall be Cho≈øen and Elected by the Lord Mayor of this City for the time being, to be Sheriffs of the ≈øaid City and County of Middle≈øex; as al≈øo for the Choice and Election of ≈øuch other Per≈øons as by the Lord Mayor, Aldermen and Commons ≈øhall be Cho≈øen to be Sheriffs of the ≈øaid City and County of Middle≈øex, ≈øhall be yearly holden on the Four and twentieth Day of June; And if it ≈øhall happen by the Death or Refu≈øal of any of the ≈øaid Per≈øon or Per≈øons ≈øo to be Cho≈øen or Elected, as afore≈øaid, or by the Death of any Shreive of this City, Departing in the time of his Shrievalty, or upon any other Occa≈øion what≈øoever, there ≈øhall be ju≈øt Cau≈øe to make a New Election; then the ≈øame ≈øhall from time to time be at ≈øuch Day and Time, as by the Court of Lord Mayor and Aldermen for the time being, ≈øhall be Ordered and Appointed; And that no Freeman of the ≈øaid City, ≈øo
to be Cho≈øen or Elected, as is afore≈øaid, ≈øhall be Di≈øcharged or Exempted from the Execution of the ≈øaid Office of Shrievalty by Suppo≈øition or Excu≈øe of Defect, or In≈øufficiency of Wealth, except he will voluntarily take his Corporal Oath before the Lord Mayor and greater part of the Aldermen, in open Court of the Lord Mayor and Aldermen for the time being, That he then is not of the Value of Ten Thou≈øand Pounds in Lands. Goods and ≈øperate Debts, and do likewi≈øe bring with him Six other Citizens, Freemen of the ≈øame City, of good Credit and Reputation, ≈øuch as the Court of Lord Mayor and Aldermen for the time being, ≈øhall allow, who ≈øhall likewi≈øe voluntarily te≈øtifie upon their corporal Oaths, That in their Con≈øciences they believe, that the ≈øaid Per≈øon ≈øo to be cho≈øen or elected Sheriff, hath Depo≈øed and Sworn truly concerning his Value, as is afore≈øaid: And it is likewi≈øe Ordained and Enacted by the ≈øame Authority, That if any Per≈øon, being a Freeman of this City ≈øhall be Cho≈øen or Elected Sheriff of the ≈øame City and County of Middle≈øex, and Publication thereof by open Proclamation being made in the Guildhall in the place where the Court of Hu≈øtings is u≈øually holden in the Pre≈øence of the Lord Mayor and Six Aldermen for the time being (at the lea≈øt) or in the Ab≈øence of the ≈øaid Lord Mayor, then in the Pre≈øence of Eight Aldermen of the ≈øaid City for the time being (at the lea≈øt). And being called to come forth and give his Con≈øent to take the ≈øaid Office of Shrievalty upon him, ≈øhall not per≈øonally appear before the Lord Mayor and Court of Aldermen for the time
being, in the Inner Chamber of the Guild-hall afore≈øaid, at the next Court there to be holden (unle≈øs he have ≈øuch rea≈øonable Excu≈øe as the Lord Mayor and greater part of the Aldermen for the time being, ≈øhall in open Court allow) and then and there become bounden to the Chamberlain of the ≈øame City, for the time being, and his Succe≈ø≈øors by his Deed Obligatory, in the Sum of One thou≈øand Pounds, with Condition. That if he ≈øhall per≈øonally appear in the Publick A≈ø≈øembly in the Guild-hall of the ≈øame City on the Vigil of St. Michael the Arch-Angel then next following at the Time in that behalf accu≈øtomed, and then and there take upon him the Office and Charge of Shrievalty of the ≈øaid City and County, That then the ≈øaid Obligation ≈øhall be void; Or if ≈øuch Per≈øon ≈øo to be cho≈øen or elected, ≈øhall, before the Lord Mayor and Court of Aldermen openly declare his Refu≈øal to take upon him the ≈øaid Office, Then every ≈øuch Per≈øon which ≈øhall make ≈øuch Default in Appearance, by which ≈øhall not become bounden, or which ≈øhall declare his Refu≈øal, as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall Forfeit the Sum of Four Hundred Pounds of Lawful Money of England to the Mayor and Commonalty of the ≈øame City, to be Imployed to the V≈øes hereafter declared and expre≈ø≈øed, unle≈øs he ≈øhall be duly di≈øcharged of the ≈øaid Office of Shrievalty, for Want or Defect of Ability in Wealth, upon Oath taken, as is afore≈øaid. Provided neverthele≈øs, and Be it Enacted, Ordained and E≈øtabli≈øhed by the Authority afore≈øaid, (any thing in this Act to the contrary notwith≈øtanding) That if the Per≈øon ≈øo to be cho≈øen or elected, and making Default
in appearing, or denying to become Bounden, or that ≈øhall declare his Refu≈øal, as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall be an Alderman of this City at the time of his Choice or Election, then every ≈øuch Alderman ≈øo to be cho≈øen or elected, ≈øhall Forfeit the Sum of Six hundred Marks, of Lawful Money of England, to the Mayor and Commonalty of the ≈øame City, to be imployed to the V≈øes hereafter in this Act Declared and Expre≈ø≈øed. All which Forfeitures or Penalties ≈øhall be recovered by Action, or Bill of Debt Original, to be commenced and pro≈øecuted in any the Courts of Record of the King's Maje≈øty, or His Heirs and Succe≈ø≈øors, within the ≈øaid City; And that the ≈øame Per≈øon or Per≈øons ≈øo Offending, or Refu≈øing, after ≈øuch Forfeiture, ≈øhall neverthele≈øs remain Eligible yearly afterward to be Sheriff of the ≈øaid City and County, as if he or they had never been before Cho≈øen or Elected to the ≈øaid Office. Provided al≈øo, and it is likewi≈øe Enacted and Declared, touching the V≈øes and Imployment of the ≈øaid Forfeitures, That if any ≈øuch Default or Forfeiture ≈øhall be made, as afore≈øaid, by any Per≈øon that ≈øhall fir≈øt in any Year be Cho≈øen or Elected by the Lord Mayor for the time being, to be Shrieve of the City of London, and County of Middle≈øex, That then One hundred Pounds, parcel of ≈øuch Forfeitures, ≈øhall be given and be≈øtowed upon ≈øuch Per≈øon as ≈øhall fir≈øt in the ≈øame Year accept to take upon him the ≈øaid Office of Shrievalty: And if it ≈øhall happen after ≈øuch Acceptation of the ≈øaid Office, any other Forfeiture by Default or Refu≈øal ≈øhall be made in the ≈øame Year by any per≈øon that ≈øhall be Cho≈øen or Elected by the Lord Mayor, Aldermen
and Commons, for the time being, to be Sheriff of the ≈øaid City and County of Middle≈øex, That then One hundred Pounds parcel of ≈øuch Forfeiture ≈øhall be given and be≈øtowed upon ≈øuch other Per≈øon as ≈øhall fir≈øt after ≈øuch Forfeiture in the ≈øame Year accept and take upon him the ≈øaid Office of Shrievalty, being thereunto Elected and Cho≈øen by the Lord Mayor, Aldermen and Commons of the ≈øame City; And that all the Re≈øidue of the ≈øame Forfeitures, and all other Forfeitures and Penalties for Refu≈øal, or making Default to appear, denying to become Bound, or declaring Refu≈øal to take the ≈øaid Office of Shrievalty, as is afore≈øaid, ≈øhall be wholly and intirely V≈øed and Imployed to the only V≈øe and Behalf of the Mayor, and Commonalty and Citizens of the ≈øaid City; any Act, Law, or Ordinance to the contrary in any wi≈øe notwith≈øtanding. And be it further Enacted by the Authority afore≈øaid, That if any Freeman of this City, which ≈øhall incur any Penalty or Forfeiture before declared, by Force of this Act, ≈øhall not within Three Months next after ≈øuch Forfeiture incurred, well and truly pay unto the Chamberlain of the ≈øaid City, for the time being, all ≈øuch Penalties and Forfeitures to ≈øuch V≈øes as in this Act is appointed and declared, That then every ≈øuch Per≈øon failing of ≈øuch Payment, ≈øhall, over and above the ≈øaid Penalties and Forfeitures before declared, Forfeit and Lo≈øe the Sum of One hundred Pounds more to the V≈øe of the ≈øaid Mayor and Commonalty, to be Recovered in Form above≈øaid. And to the intent that no Alderman of this City ≈øhall, in re≈øpect of Po≈øteriority of Choice or Election to the ≈øaid
Office of Shrievalty, be inferiour in Antiency or Preheminence to any Commoner, and for other good Con≈øiderations: It is therefore Enacted, That the Lord Mayor of the ≈øaid City for the time being, ≈øhall not at any time hereafter choo≈øe or elect any Commoner of this City to be Sheriff of this City of London, and of the County of Middle≈øex, ≈øo long as there ≈øhall then be an Alderman of this City Eligible to the ≈øaid Office; Any former Law, Cu≈øtom, V≈øage, or other Matter what≈øoever to the contrary notwith≈øtanding. And to the intent that the Court of Lord Mayor and Aldermen of this City for the time being, ≈øhall not be burdened or charged with any Vnkindne≈øs, nor pe≈øtered with Importunate Suits. if they ≈øhall refu≈øe to relieve ≈øuch Per≈øons as ≈øhall make Default, or deny to become Bound, or refu≈øe to Accept of the ≈øaid Office of Shrievalty, as is afore≈øaid. And for other good Confiderations, it is likewi≈øe Declared and Enacted, That the Court of Lord Mayor and Aldermen of this City for the time being have not, nor ≈øhall have Power nor Authority in any ca≈øe, without the A≈ø≈øent of the Commoners in publick Common Council of this City fir≈øt had and obtained, to Di≈øpen≈øe with, Remit or Abate any of the ≈øaid Forfeitures, or any part thereof. which at any time hereafter ≈øhall happen or grow Due by Force of this Act; nor to give Re≈øpite of Payment thereof, or of any part thereof, above the Term of One Year at the mo≈øt; nor to give any Re≈øtraint or Delay of Suit to be commenced and pro≈øecuted for Recovery thereof.

div.head:
Commune Concilium tent' in Camera Guihald' Civitat' LONDON, die Veneris decimo quinto die Junij 1694. Anno
que Regni Dom' Willielmi & Dom' Mariae nunc Regis & Reginae, Angl', &c. Sexto, Coram Will' A≈øhhur≈øt Mil' Major' dictae Civitatis, Roberto Clayton Mil'. Patienc' Ward Mil', Will' Pritchard Mil', Roberto Jeffreys Mil', Thoma Lane Mil', Edvardo Clark Mil', Franci≈øco Child Mil', Richardo Levett Mil', Thoma Cook Mil' Alderman', & Thoma Abney Mil', & VVill' Hedges Mil' Vic' & Alderman' dict' Civitat', nec non major' parte Communiar' dictae Civitat' in eodem Communi Concilio tunc & ibidem a≈ø≈øemblat'.
div.p: WHereas by a Clau≈øe in an Act of Common Council made the Twentieth Day of July, in the Seventh Year of the Reign of King CHARLES the Fir≈øt, in the Majoralty of Sir Robert Ducy, It was among≈øt other things Enacted in the Words following, That the Lord Mayor of this City, for the time being, ≈øhall not at any time hereafter choo≈øe or elect any Commoner of this City to be Sheriff of the City of London, and of the County of Middle≈øex, ≈øo long as there ≈øhall then be an Alderman of the City Eligible to the ≈øaid Office.
Which ≈øaid Clau≈øe, in re≈øpect of Accidents or Circum≈øtances, may not at all times be convenient to be practi≈øed.

And whereas by another Clau≈øe in an Act of Common Council, made the Sixth Day of June, in the Thirty fifth Year of King Charles the Second, in the Mayoralty of Sir William Pritchard, Knight; It was among≈øt other things Enacted in the Words following, That the
Per≈øon who ≈øhall be Nominated and Elected according to ancient V≈øage by the Lord Mayor of this City, for the time being, to be one of the Sheriffs of the City of London, and County of Middle≈øex, and ≈øuch Election ≈øhall be declared to the Commons of the ≈øaid City a≈ø≈øembled in Common Hall upon the Twenty fourth day of June, ≈øhall there by the ≈øaid Commons be confirmed and allowed to be one of the Sheriffs of the ≈øaid City and County accordingly: And that upon propo≈øing the ≈øaid Per≈øon to be confirmed to the ≈øaid Common Hall, in ca≈øe any Hands ≈øhall be holden up in token of Confirmation, the ≈øaid Per≈øon ≈øhall be taken to be confirmed and allowed, and then another Per≈øon ≈øhall be cho≈øen by majority of Hands to be the other of the ≈øaid Sheriffs, and to joyn with him that ≈øhall be ≈øo confirmed.
Which ≈øaid Clau≈øe being not only repugnant to Rea≈øon, but contrary to the Rules and Methods of Elections:

Be it therefore Enacted by the Mayor, Aldermen and Commons in Common Council A≈ø≈øembled, and by the Authority of the ≈øame, That the ≈øaid ≈øeveral Clau≈øes before-recited, and either of them, and every Article and Thing contained in them, or either of them, ≈øhall be, and are hereby Repealed, Annulled and made Void.

And whereas by ≈øeveral Acts of Common Council, the Election of Sheriffs, Chamberlain, Bridgma≈øters and Auditors of the Chamberlain and Bridghou≈øe-Accounts, and Aleconners, are appointed on Mid≈øummer-day yearly, except the Sheriff or Sheriffs, Chamberlain, or
other of the ≈øaid Officers, for the time being, ≈øhall die, or for ju≈øt Cau≈øe be removed: And whereas in ≈øome years (as in this pre≈øent year) Mid≈øummer-day happeneth to fall on the Lords Day, commonly called Sunday, which ought to be kept holy, and is a nece≈ø≈øary and required part of the Service of God, and enjoyned by the Laws and Statutes of this Realm;

Be it therefore Enacted and Declared, That from henceforth, when≈øoever Mid≈øummer-day ≈øhall happen to be on the Lords Day, commonly called Sunday, That the Election of the Sheriffs, Chamberlain, Bridgma≈øters, Auditors of the Chamberlain and Bridghou≈øe-Accounts, and Aleconners ≈øhall be on the Day next following, any Act or Acts, or any other V≈øage to the contrary notwith≈øtanding.
Printed by Samuel Roycroft, Printer to the Honourable City of London. 1700.
